head.title: To Train and Keep Good Teachers

hedline.hl1: To Train and Keep Good Teachers

abstract.p: Eileen T Greenspun letter on Aug 24 article cites importance of teacher training

block.p: Re ''Less Training, More Teachers: New Math for Staffing Classes'' (front page, Aug. 24):

The belief that subject-matter knowledge is enough to create a good teacher is comparable to believing that a person who has studied anatomy would be a good surgeon. Child psychology, awareness of developmentally appropriate activities and knowledge of curriculum give the new teacher a foundation from which to develop the skills required to meet students' individual needs.
Re ''Less Training, More Teachers: New Math for Staffing Classes'' (front page, Aug. 24):

The belief that subject-matter knowledge is enough to create a good teacher is comparable to believing that a person who has studied anatomy would be a good surgeon. Child psychology, awareness of developmentally appropriate activities and knowledge of curriculum give the new teacher a foundation from which to develop the skills required to meet students' individual needs.
To imply that quick credentialing will create a better cadre of teachers is ridiculous.
EILEEN T. GREENSPUN Staten Island, Aug. 24, 2000
The writer is an assistant principal in the New York City public school system.
